explains: n. （Mater）人名；（阿拉伯）马塔尔；（德）马特；（英）梅特

sentences.en: At Princeton, alumni parade through the town wearing their class uniforms and singing their alma mater.
sentences.cn: 在普林斯顿，校友们穿着他们的校服，唱着他们的母校的歌在城里游行。

sentences.en: He represents Cambridge University, the alma mater, where Edward King and John Milton had been students.
sentences.cn: 他代表着母校剑桥大学，爱德华·金和约翰·弥尔顿曾是该校的学生。

sentences.en: Gadaffi picked up victims at his former alma mater, Tripoli University, where he gave lectures and then led the young women to a nearby room .
sentences.cn: 卡扎菲在他的前母校的黎波里大学接走了一些受害者，在那里他做了演讲，然后把这些年轻妇女带到附近的一个房间。
